poem:
Title: Judicial Discourse / The Jury's Garden

In the garden of justice,
pub arguments bloom – 
quicksilver questions red as roses.
"Can trust grow here?" 
A no echoes, pallid as lilies.
Four parts of tangled tale 
spun beneath the British sky,
A docudrama seed sown in doubt
ripe with spoilers, ready to be plucked.
A sour fruit, our system unraveled.
